summary: Business app for an IT firm combining service listings and an e-commerce store (products like domains/hosting, computer parts, etc.), with customer accounts, payment gateway, and a fully editable admin panel to manage items and branding (logo/images).

existing_features.title: Create a customer-facing web app that includes (a) a Services catalog and (b) an E-commerce store, with clear navigation between: Home, Services, Store, Product Detail, Cart, Checkout, and Account pages.
Add customer account access using Internet Identity authentication and show an Account area where signed-in users can view their basic profile info and their order history.

Create an Admin Dashboard that is fully editable for managing the business content: Services and Products (create/edit/delete), including fields such as name/title, description, category, pricing (where applicable), and images.
Add site branding management so the admin can upload/change the app logo and key images at any time, and the customer-facing app uses the currently configured branding assets.

Add a payment gateway checkout flow for store purchases using Stripe Checkout (or equivalent supported payment gateway), including order creation, payment status tracking, and a success/cancel return experience in the UI.
Apply a coherent, distinct visual theme across the frontend (colors, typography, layout, components) appropriate for an IT services + retail business, avoiding a blue/purple default palette.

Update the Admin Branding UI to allow admins to configure: (a) Logo URL, (b) a list of Slider image URLs (add/remove multiple), and (c) a list of Banner image URLs (add/remove multiple), with image previews.

Render the configured branding slider and banners in the customer-facing UI: show a homepage image slider when slider images are configured, and show a banner image in the store and product detail pages when banner images are configured.

Update the Admin Dashboard UI to allow admins to edit and save: WhatsApp link, Facebook link, YouTube link, and language selector options (including a default language), using the existing branding update flow.
Render the configured WhatsApp, Facebook, YouTube buttons and a language selector in the top site header; social buttons must open the configured URLs and only appear when configured.

Implement client-side language selection persistence: selecting a language in the header should persist across page reloads for that browser (without requiring authentication), and should default to the admin-configured default language when no previous selection exists.
Add a user-facing "Copy link" action that copies the current app URL to the clipboard so the user can share/open the published app via a single link.
Expose the same "Copy link" action in the Admin Dashboard area so admins can easily copy/share the published app URL.

new_feature_requests.summary: Service catalog module covering IT firm services (WordPress website selling, domain & hosting sales, computer servicing, other services)
E-commerce store for selling products (e.g., computer parts and other products)
Admin panel to add/edit/update products and service items (fully editable by admin)
Branding management: allow uploading/changing app logo and images

Implement backend data models and persistence for: Service items, Products, Orders, and Site Branding (logo and key images). Provide query/update methods needed by the frontend to list, view, create, update, and delete services/products; create and view orders; and read/update branding assets.
Implement admin authorization controls in the backend, including an initial admin principal list and admin-only methods to manage who is an admin (add/remove).
Add branding UI options for homepage slider and banner(s), manageable via admin (upload/change images and related settings)

Extend the backend SiteBranding model to support separate configurable image lists for (1) a homepage slider and (2) store/product banners, and expose them through the existing getSiteBranding/updateBranding methods.
Add top-bar buttons for WhatsApp, Facebook, YouTube, and a Language selector; all options/links configurable (editable) via the admin panel

Extend the backend SiteBranding model to store admin-editable top-header settings for (a) WhatsApp, Facebook, and YouTube links and (b) a language selector configuration (available languages and default language).

Add a conditional state migration for existing deployments so previously stored SiteBranding data (logo, homepageSliderImages, storeBanners) is preserved and the new social/language fields are initialized to defaults.

projectName: IT Firm Services + E-commerce App with Admin Editing, Branding, Accounts, and Payments
